name: Ballyhoo Cocktail
note: Recipe by Victor Anthony, New York.

name: Bamboo Cocktail
note: Recipe by Charlie Mahoney, Hoffman House, New York.

name: Bernice
note: By C. S. Berner of the Tail O' the Cock restaurant, Los Angeles. 1st Prize 1950 West Coast competition.

name: Bijou Cocktail
instruction: Mix well with a spoon, strain into a cocktail glass, add a cherry or olive, squeeze a piece of lemon peel on top, and serve.
note: Recipe from Harry Johnson of New Orleans.

name: Blackthorn Cocktail
instruction: Shake well, and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Blanche Cocktail
instruction: Shake well and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Bloodhound Cocktail
note: This cocktail was introduced to London by the Duke of Manchester.

name: Blue Blazer
instruction: Melt the sugar in boiling water in one mug. Ignite the Scotch in the other mug. Pour the flaming Scotch back and forth between the mugs about six or seven times, creating a blaze of flames.
note: Rye or Bourbon may be used.

name: Blue Ribbon Cocktail
ingredients: Six drops Breton Cooking Blue Dye
note: Invented by the author, at Club, London, 1919.

name: Brandy Crusta
instruction: Moisten the rim of a wineglass with lemon, dip in sugar for a frosted effect. Fit a spiral lemon peel into the glass, shake the ingredients, and pour into the prepared glass.

name: Brandy Daisy
instruction: Shake well, strain, pour into a double-sized cocktail glass, add a cherry and other fruit in season, and a squirt of Soda Water.

name: Brandy Fix
instruction: Fill the glass with fine ice and stir slowly. Add a slice of lemon and serve with a straw.

name: Brandy Flip
instruction: Shake well, strain into a small wineglass, and grate a little Nutmeg on top.

name: Brandy Highball
instruction: Add a piece of lemon peel squeezed in the glass with a chunk of ice. Top with soda water.

name: Brandy Julep
instruction: Same as Mint Julep, but with Brandy.

name: Brandy Punch
instruction: In a large fancy wineglass, half fill with crushed ice. Stir well, decorate with fruits in season, and flavor with a few drops of Rum on top.

name: Brandy Smash
instruction: Dissolve sugar in water, add mint to extract flavor, then remove mint. Add brandy, shake well, pour into a wineglass half full of fine ice, and decorate with fruits in season.

name: Brandy Sour
instruction: Shake well, strain into a wineglass, squirt a little syphon water on top, and decorate with fruit.

name: Brazil Cocktail
instruction: Stir well, strain into a cocktail glass, add a cherry, and squeeze a piece of lemon peel on top.

name: Broken Spur Cocktail
note: Introduced by the cavalry disbanded during the war.

name: Bromo Seltzer
instruction: In a large tumbler, dissolve Bromo Seltzer in soda water by pouring back and forth until dissolved. Drink while fizzing.
note: A good pick-me-up for that next morning feeling.

name: Bull-dog
instruction: Stir, and serve with a straw.
